Options: Loss of sense of smell and/or taste

Environmental Safety Management.Field Name: Demo's ability uses called light with success

Options: Control with any catheter or ostomy over last 24 hours
Disturbance in voice pitch or intensity
Speaks one or two word sentences
Comprehends one or two word sentences
Unable to follow visual guided command
Cough/Frequent throat clearing with oral intake

Glasgow Coma Assessment.Desired Format: Add up previous 3 rows (score out of 15)

Options: Atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response
Atrial flutter with rapid ventricular response
Denies shortness of breath at rest
Denies shortness of breath with usual activity
Shortness of breath with mild exertion
Shortness of breath with moderate exertion
Decreased food intake for the past 7 days
Fluid intake less than 50% of normal in last 3 days
Fortified breast milk or fortified baby formula at home
Type 3: Like a sausage or snake but with cracks on its surface
Type 4: Like a sausage or snake
Type 5: Soft blobs with clear-cut edges (passed easily)
Type 6: Fluffy pieces with ragged edges

Integumentary Assessment.Field Name: Head to toe pressure injury skin check

Options: 0% - No foreign body present; wound bed clean
25% - Small portion of wound bed contains foreign material
50% - Moderate amount of foreign material covering the wound bed
75% - Majority of wound bed contains foreign material
100% - Entire wound bed is covered by foreign material or objects
0% - Granulation or epithelial tissue, no underlying structures visible
25% - Small portion of bone, tendon, or other underlying structures visible
50% - Significant portion of the wound bed exposes underlying structures
75% - Most of the wound bed exposes bone, tendon, or other structures
100% - Entire wound bed exposes underlying structures such as bone, tendon, or muscle

Morse Fall Scale.Field Name: History of fall in last 3 months
